event.name: wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK
event.help: Unlike all the other key events, this event is propagated upwards the window hierarchy which allows intercepting it in the parent window of the focused window to which it is sent initially (if there is no focused window, this event is sent to the wxApp global object). It is also generated before any other key events and so gives the parent window an opportunity to modify the keyboard handling of its children, e.g. it is used internally by wxWidgets in some ports to intercept pressing Esc key in any child of a dialog to close the dialog itself when it's pressed. By default, if this event is handled, i.e. the handler doesn't call wxEvent::Skip(), neither wxEVT_KEY_DOWN nor wxEVT_CHAR events will be generated (although wxEVT_KEY_UP still will be), i.e. it replaces the normal key events. However by calling the special DoAllowNextEvent() method you can handle wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK and still allow normal events generation. This is something that is rarely useful but can be required if you need to prevent a parent wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK handler from running without suppressing the normal key events. Finally notice that this event is not generated when the mouse is captured as it is considered that the window which has the capture should receive all the keyboard events too without allowing its parent wxTopLevelWindow to interfere with their processing.

event.name: wxEVT_KEY_DOWN
event.help: Generated when any key has been pressed. If this event is handled and not skipped, wxEVT_CHAR will not be generated at all for this key press (but wxEVT_KEY_UP will be).

event.name: wxEVT_KEY_UP
event.help: Generated when any key has been released.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_BEGIN_DRAG
event.help: Generated when beginning to drag with the left mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_BEGIN_RDRAG
event.help: Generated when beginning to drag with the right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_END_DRAG
event.help: Generated when ending dragging with the left or right mouse button.

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_BEGIN_LABEL_EDIT
event.help: This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_END_LABEL_EDIT
event.help: This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSING
event.help: This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING
event.help: This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGING
event.help: This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: wxEVT_TREE_ITEM_MENU
event.help: Generated when the context menu for the selected item has been requested, either by a right click or by using the menu key.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: This is the bitmap shown in the default state. It will also be used for all other bitmaps if they are not explicitly set.

property.name: disabled_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is disabled.

property.name: pressed_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is pushed (e.g. while the user keeps the mouse button pressed on it).

property.name: focus_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button has keyboard focus but is not pressed.

property.name: current
property.help: Bitmap shown when the mouse is over the button (but it is not pressed). Notice that if hover bitmap is not specified but the current platform UI uses hover images for the buttons (such as Windows XP or GTK+), then the focus bitmap is used for the hover state as well. This makes it possible to set just the focus bitmap to get reasonably good behaviour on all platforms.

option.name: wxLEFT
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the left

option.name: wxRIGHT
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the right

option.name: wxTOP
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the top

option.name: wxBOTTOM
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the bottom

property.name: margins
property.help: The margins between the bitmap and the text of the button. This is currently only implemented under MSW. If it is not specified, a default margin is used around the bitmap.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: This is the bitmap shown in the default state. It will also be used for all other bitmaps if they are not explicitly set.

property.name: disabled_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is disabled.

property.name: pressed_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is pushed (e.g. while the user keeps the mouse button pressed on it).

property.name: focus_bmp
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button has keyboard focus but is not pressed.

property.name: current
property.help: Bitmap shown when the mouse is over the button (but it is not pressed). Notice that if hover bitmap is not specified but the current platform UI uses hover images for the buttons (such as Windows XP or GTK+), then the focus bitmap is used for the hover state as well. This makes it possible to set just the focus bitmap to get reasonably good behaviour on all platforms.

property.name: id
property.help: The identifier for the dialog.

property.name: pos
property.help: Sets the dialog position. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default position for the dialog.

property.name: size
property.help: Sets the dialog size. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default size for the dialog, large enough to display all visible elements.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the dialog. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates wxWidgets should calculate a minimum size large enough to display all visible elements.

property.name: maximum_size
property.help: Sets the maximum size of the dialog.

property.name: foreground_colour
property.help: Sets the foreground colour of the dialog.

property.name: background_colour
property.help: Sets the background colour of the dialog.

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for the dialog. This should not be used if you don't want the font to be inherited by the dialog's children

property.name: window_name
property.help: Used to associate a name with the window, allowing the application user to set Motif resource values for individual dialog boxes.

property.name: derived_class
property.help: If you have derived a class from wxDialog and you want to use your derived class, then specify that class name here. You will need to add the header file for your class to the base_hdr_includes property. Note that your base class must specify a constructor with no parameters to match a wxDialog() constructor.

property.name: base_file
property.help: The filename of the base class.

property.name: source_preamble
property.help: This preamble is added in addition to any src_preamble specified for the entire project. It will be placed unchanged at the top of the generated base src file after any (optional) precompiled header file.

property.name: local_src_includes
property.help: Lists one or more local header files to include in the generated header file.

property.name: system_src_includes
property.help: Lists one or more system header files to include in the generated header file.

property.name: generate_ids
property.help: If checked, any non-wxWidgets ids will be created as an enumerated list unless you specically assign the value of the id (e.g., myid=100).

property.name: initial_enum_string
property.help: The first id in a generated enum will be set to this value.

property.name: class_decoration
property.help: This specifies the keyword or macro to add to the class declaration (such as __declspec(dllexport) ).

property.name: name_space
property.help: If specified, this will override any name_space specified for the entire project. Note that the class name must still be unique to the project in spite of using a name_space.

property.name: header_preamble
property.help: This preamble is placed unchanged in the generated header file after all wx/ include files. It is commonly used to add forward class names needed by methods and members you add to the Derived Class Settings.

property.name: local_hdr_includes
property.help: Lists one or more local header files to include in the generated header file.

property.name: system_hdr_includes
property.help: Lists one or more system header files to include in the generated header file.

property.name: inserted_hdr_code
property.help: Specify code to insert into the header file at the end of the public: section. You may add protected: and private: sections as needed for additional methods and member variables.

property.name: generate_const_values
property.help: If checked, each form's header file will have const values declared for some of the possible parameters. E.g., const int form_id = your_id. You can use this when creating multiple instances of a form with different construction parameters.

property.name: no_closing_brace
property.help: If checked no closing brace (};) will be generated at the end of the header file. This allows you to extend the class definition after the generated code block.

property.name: use_derived_class
property.help: Check this if you will be creating a derived class. If not checked, you can implement any event handlers below the generated file's final comment block.

property.name: derived_class_name
property.help: The name of the derived class. Ignored if use_derived_class is unchecked.

property.name: derived_file
property.help: The filename of the derived class. You can leave this empty if you have already generated the file. Ignored if use_derived_class is unchecked.

property.name: additional_inheritance
property.help: Additional classes to inherit from (these can be your own classes if you specified their header file in base_hdr_includes in the C++ Settings section above).

property.name: class_methods
property.help: Additional public class methods to add (useful if you are *not* using a derived class.)

property.name: protected_class_methods
property.help: Additional protected class methods to add (useful if you are *not* using a derived class.)

property.name: class_members
property.help: Additional class variable members to add (useful if you are *not* using a derived class.)

property.name: private_members
property.help: Check this to make all class member variables private: instead of protected:. This can only be done if you are *not* creating a derived class (use_derived_class is unchecked).

property.name: python_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxPython.

property.name: insert_python_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the python file after the generated import statements. This is usually used to import addtional modules, but can be any valid python code for use before the class definition.

property.name: python_import_list
property.help: Specifies the python modules that should be imported. These will be added using the import command.

property.name: python_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Python panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: ruby_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxRuby.

property.name: insert_ruby_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the ruby file after the generated import statements. This can be any valid ruby code for use before the class definition.

property.name: relative_require_list
property.help: Specifies the ruby modules that are required by this module. These will be added using the relative_require command, and are relative to the location of this generated file.

property.name: ruby_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Ruby panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: golang_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxRuby.

property.name: golang_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Golang panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: insert_golang_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the Go file after the generated import statements. This can be any valid Go code for use before the class definition.

property.name: golang_import_list
property.help: Specifies the Go modules that should be imported. These will be placed in quotes and added using the import command.

property.name: lua_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxRuby.

property.name: lua_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Lua panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: insert_lua_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the Lua file after the generated import statements. This can be any valid Lua code for use before the class definition.

property.name: lua_require_list
property.help: Specifies the Lua modules that are required for this module. These will be placed in quotes and added using the require command.

property.name: perl_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxRuby.

property.name: perl_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Ruby panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: insert_perl_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the Perl file after the generated import statements. This can be any valid Perl code for use before the class definition.

property.name: perl_package_list
property.help: Specifies the Perl packages that are required for this module. These will be added via the use command.

property.name: rust_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating code for wxRuby.

property.name: rust_inherit_name
property.help: The name to use for an inherited class. If specified, the Inherit tab in the Ruby panel will include a sample for creating an inherited class.

property.name: insert_rust_code
property.help: Specify the code to insert into the Rust file after the generated import statements. This can be any valid Rust code for use before the class definition.

property.name: rust_module_list
property.help: Specifies the Rust modules that are used in this module. These will be added via the use command.

property.name: xrc_file
property.help: The filename to use if generating XRC (wxPython can override this with its own file name).

property.name: xrc_no_whitespace
property.help: If checked, no leading whitespace will be used. This makes the file smaller, but less readable.

property.name: wxWidgets_version
property.help: If you specify a control or property that requires a wxWidgets version later than this number, then the code will be generated within a conditional block.

property.name: base_directory
property.help: The generated base class output directory. If a form's base_file contains only a filename (without a path), the files will be generated in this directory. Leave blank to generate the in the same directory as the project file.

property.name: derived_directory
property.help: The generated derived class output directory. Leave blank to generate them in the same directory as the project file.

property.name: source_ext
property.help: Specifies the file extension to use when creating C++ source files.

property.name: header_ext
property.help: Specifies the file extension to use when creating C++ header files.

property.name: cpp_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: local_pch_file
property.help: The filename of a local precompiled header file. The file will be included in quotes.

property.name: src_preamble
property.help: Code to generate at the top of all source files after the inclusion of any local precompiled header file. This can include header files, comments, macros, etc.

property.name: project_src_includes
property.help: Lists one or more local header files to include in all generated source files.

property.name: name_space
property.help: Namespace to enclose class declarations in. Separate nested namespaces with a double colon (e.g. company::app::subname)

property.name: generate_cmake
property.help: If checked, this will auto-generate a .cmake file whenever C++ code is generated.

property.name: cmake_file
property.help: The filename of the cmake file to create. By default, this will be created in the same directory as the project file.

property.name: cmake_varname
property.help: The variable name to set in the .cmake file. This will contain paths to every generated class.

property.name: xrc_directory
property.help: The directory to generate xrc files in. Leave blank to generate them in the same directory as the project file.

property.name: combine_all_forms
property.help: If checked, Export XRC (File menu) will create a single XRC file containing all forms.

property.name: combined_xrc_file
property.help: This filename will be used to write all XRC content to unless you unchecked the combine_all_forms property above.

property.name: xrc_art_directory
property.help: The directory containing the images your XRC file will load.

property.name: wxPython_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxPython needed to run the generated code.

property.name: python_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all python code.

property.name: python_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: python_project_preamble
property.help: Code to generate at the top of every source file after the comment block and before the first import statement.

property.name: wxRuby_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxRuby needed to run the generated code.

property.name: ruby_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all ruby code.

property.name: ruby_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: disable_rubo_cop
property.help: If checked, all RuboCop warnings will be disabled within the generated code.

property.name: ruby_project_preamble
property.help: Code to generate at the top of every source file after the comment block and any disabled RuboCop warnings.

property.name: wxGo_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxGo needed to run the generated code.

property.name: golang_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all Go code.

property.name: golang_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: wxLua_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxLua needed to run the generated code.

property.name: lua_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all Lua code.

property.name: lua_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: wxPerl_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxPerl needed to run the generated code.

property.name: perl_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all Perl code.

property.name: perl_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: wxRust_version
property.help: Specifies the minimum version of wxRust needed to run the generated code.

property.name: rust_output_folder
property.help: If a folder name is specified, it will be used for all Rust code.

property.name: rust_line_length
property.help: Specifies a guideline for generated code line length. Most lines will be wrapped so that they do not exceed this length.

property.name: folder_base_directory
property.help: Overrides any project setting of generated base class output directory. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_derived_directory
property.help: Overrides any project setting of derived class output directory. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_namespace
property.help: Overrides any project setting of namespace to enclose class declarations in. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_cmake_file
property.help: Overrides any project setting of filename of the cmake file to create. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_cmake_varname
property.help: Overrides any project setting of the variable name to set in the .cmake file. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_python_output_folder
property.help: Overrides any project setting of the output folder used for all generated python code. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_ruby_output_folder
property.help: Overrides any project setting of the output folder used for all generated ruby code. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_xrc_directory
property.help: Overrides any project setting of the output folder used for all generated XRC code. Only affects the forms within this folder.

property.name: folder_combined_xrc_file
property.help: Overrides any project setting of the combined filename. Only affects the forms within this folder.

option.name: wxALIGN_LEFT
option.help: Align the item to the left of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_TOP
option.help: Align the item to the top of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_RIGHT
option.help: Align the item to the right of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_BOTTOM
option.help: Align the item to the bottom of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER
option.help: Align the item to the center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER_HORIZONTAL
option.help: Align the item to the horizontal center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER_VERTICAL
option.help: Align the item to the vertical center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

property.name: border_size
property.help: Sets the border size, if the flag parameter is set to include any border flag. The default value of 5 will be scaled on high DPI displayes.

property.name: scale_border_size
property.help: If checked, the border size will be scaled on high DPI displays. Always scaled if size is 5, 10 or 15.

option.name: wxEXPAND
option.help: The item will be expanded to fill the space assigned to the item.

option.name: wxSHAPED
option.help: The item will be expanded as much as possible while also maintaining its aspect ratio.

option.name: wxFIXED_MINSIZE
option.help: Normally wxSizers will use GetAdjustedBestSize to determine what the minimal size of window items should be, and will use that size to calculate the layout. This allows layouts to adjust when an item changes and its best size becomes different. If you would rather have a window item stay the size it started with then use wxFIXED_MINSIZE.

option.name: wxRESERVE_SPACE_EVEN_IF_HIDDEN
option.help: Normally wxSizers don't allocate space for hidden windows or other items. This flag overrides this behaviour so that sufficient space is allocated for the window even if it isn't visible. This makes it possible to dynamically show and hide controls without resizing the parent window.

property.name: proportion
property.help: How much this control will stretch in proportion to the other controls in the same sizer. Set to 0 to prevent stretching.

property.name: row
property.help: Row for the item.

property.name: column
property.help: Column for the item.

property.name: rowspan
property.help: The number of rows that the item spans.

property.name: colspan
property.help: The number of columns that the item spans.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Normally, the sizer will calculate its minimal size based purely on how much space its children need. If the minimal size is > 0, 'GetMinSize' will return either the minimal size as requested by its children or the minimal size set here, depending on which is bigger.

option.name: wxALIGN_LEFT
option.help: Align the item to the left of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_TOP
option.help: Align the item to the top of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_RIGHT
option.help: Align the item to the right of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_BOTTOM
option.help: Align the item to the bottom of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER
option.help: Align the item to the center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER_HORIZONTAL
option.help: Align the item to the horizontal center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

option.name: wxALIGN_CENTER_VERTICAL
option.help: Align the item to the vertical center of the space allotted to it by the sizer, adjusted for the border if any.

property.name: border_size
property.help: Sets the border size, if the flag parameter is set to include any border flag. The default value of 5 will be scaled on high DPI displayes.

property.name: scale_border_size
property.help: If checked, the border size will be scaled on high DPI displays. Always scaled if size is 5, 10 or 15.

option.name: wxEXPAND
option.help: The item will be expanded to fill the space assigned to the item.

option.name: wxSHAPED
option.help: The item will be expanded as much as possible while also maintaining its aspect ratio.

option.name: wxFIXED_MINSIZE
option.help: Normally wxSizers will use GetAdjustedBestSize to determine what the minimal size of window items should be, and will use that size to calculate the layout. This allows layouts to adjust when an item changes and its best size becomes different. If you would rather have a window item stay the size it started with then use wxFIXED_MINSIZE.

option.name: wxRESERVE_SPACE_EVEN_IF_HIDDEN
option.help: Normally wxSizers don't allocate space for hidden windows or other items. This flag overrides this behaviour so that sufficient space is allocated for the window even if it isn't visible. This makes it possible to dynamically show and hide controls without resizing the parent window.

property.name: vgap
property.help: The vertical gap (in pixels) between the cells in the sizer.

property.name: hgap
property.help: The horizontal gap (in pixels) between cells in the sizer.

property.name: growablecols
property.help: Comma separated list of column indices (starting from zero, optional proportion appended after a colon) that should be grown if there is extra space available to the sizer.

property.name: growablerows
property.help: Comma separated list of row indices (starting from zero, optional proportion appended after a colon) that should be grown if there is extra space available to the sizer.

property.name: flexible_direction
property.help: wxFlexGridSizer can size items equally in one direction but unequally ('flexibly') in the other

property.name: non_flexible_grow_mode
property.help: If the sizer is only flexible in one direction (this can be changed using 'flexible_direction'), it needs to be decided how the sizer should grow in the other ('non flexible') direction in order to fill the available space.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: validator_data_type
property.help: Data type of the member variable

property.name: get_function
property.help: Function name to get the value of the variable.

property.name: set_function
property.help: Function name to set the value of the variable.

property.name: minValue
property.help: Used by wxIntegerValidator and wxFloatingPointValidator, this is the minimum value accepted by the validator.\n\nIgnored unless maxValue is also set.

property.name: maxValue
property.help: Used by wxIntegerValidator and wxFloatingPointValidator, this is the maximum value accepted by the validator.\n\nIgnore unless minValue is also set.

property.name: precision
property.help: Used by wxFloatingPointValidator. The number of decimal digits after the decimal separator to show and accept. -1 uses the maximum precision possible.

property.name: validator_style
property.help: Data filtering style for wxTextValidator or wxGenericValidator.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: get_function
property.help: Optional public function to get the value of the variable.

property.name: set_function
property.help: Optional public function to set the value of the variable.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: get_function
property.help: Function name to get the value of the variable.

property.name: set_function
property.help: Function name to set the value of the variable.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: validator_data_type
property.help: Data type of the member variable

property.name: get_function
property.help: Function name to get the value of the variable.

property.name: set_function
property.help: Function name to set the value of the variable.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: set_function
property.help: Function name to set the value of the variable.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: get_function
property.help: Function name to get the value of the variable.

property.name: set_function
property.help: Function name to set the value of the variable.

event.name: wxEVT_ACTIVATE
event.help: An activate event is sent when a window or application is being activated or deactivated.

event.name: wxEVT_ICONIZE
event.help: Only available for the wxMSW, wxGTK ports.

event.name: wxEVT_MAXIMIZE
event.help: Currently this event is only generated in wxMSW, wxGTK and wxOSX/Cocoa ports.

event.name: wxEVT_MOVE
event.help: Generated when a window is moved.

event.name: wxEVT_MOVING
event.help: Generated while the user is moving the window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: wxEVT_MOVE_START
event.help: Generated when the user starts to move or size a window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: wxEVT_MOVE_END
event.help: Generated when the user stops moving or sizing a window. These events are currently only generated by wxMSW port.

event.name: wxEVT_SHOW
event.help: Sent when the window is shown or hidden. Notice that the event is not triggered when the application is iconized (minimized) or restored under wxMSW.

event.name: wxEVT_IDLE
event.help: Generated when the system becomes idle.

property.name: id
property.help: Specifies the window identifier. When generating Python code, a non wx.Widgets id will be global unless prefixed with self.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the window. Any positive value will override the automatic size calculation that would normally be done.

property.name: variant
property.help: Chooses a different variant of the window display to use (calls SetWindowVariant).

property.name: maximum_size
property.help: Sets the maximum allowable size of the window.

property.name: pos
property.help: Specifies the position to pass to the constructor for the window. A -1 indicates that the value should be calculated automatically.

property.name: size
property.help: Specifies the size to pass to the constructor for the window. A -1 indicates that the value should be calculated automatically. Automatic layout (such as calling SetSizerAndFit) may override these values.

option.name: wxBORDER_DEFAULT
option.help: The window class will decide the kind of border to show, if any.

option.name: wxBORDER_SIMPLE
option.help: Displays a thin border around the window. wxSIMPLE_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_SUNKEN
option.help: Displays a sunken border. wxSUNKEN_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_RAISED
option.help: Displays a raised border. wxRAISED_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_STATIC
option.help: Displays a border suitable for a static control. wxSTATIC_BORDER is the old name for this style. Windows only.

option.name: wxBORDER_THEME
option.help: Displays a native border suitable for a control, on the current platform. On Windows XP or Vista, this will be a themed border; on most other platforms a sunken border will be used. For more information for themed borders on Windows, please see Themed borders on Windows.

option.name: wxBORDER_NONE
option.help: Displays no border, overriding the default border style for the window.

option.name: wxTRANSPARENT_WINDOW
option.help: The window is transparent, that is, it will not receive paint events. Windows only.

option.name: wxTAB_TRAVERSAL
option.help: Setting this will cause the tab key to traverse child windows.

option.name: wxWANTS_CHARS
option.help: Use this to indicate that the window wants to get all char/key events for all keys - even for keys like TAB or ENTER which are usually used for dialog navigation and which wouldn't be generated without this style. If you need to use this style in order to get the arrows or etc., but would still like to have normal keyboard navigation take place, you should call Navigate in response to the key events for Tab and Shift-Tab.

option.name: wxVSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a vertical scrollbar. Notice that this style cannot be used with native controls which don't support scrollbars nor with top-level windows in most ports.

option.name: wxHSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a horizontal scrollbar. The same limitations as for wxVSCROLL apply to this style.

option.name: wxALWAYS_SHOW_SB
option.help: If a window has scrollbars, disable them instead of hiding them when they are not needed (i.e. when the size of the window is big enough to not require the scrollbars to navigate it). This style is currently implemented for wxMSW, wxGTK and wxUniversal and does nothing on the other platforms.

option.name: wxCLIP_CHILDREN
option.help: Use this style to eliminate flicker caused by the background being repainted, then children being painted over them. Windows only.

option.name: wxFULL_REPAINT_ON_RESIZE
option.help: Use this style to force a complete redraw of the window whenever it is resized instead of redrawing just the part of the window affected by resizing. Currently this style applies on GTK+ 2 and Windows only, and full repainting is always done on other platforms.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents are propagated upward to the parent window, it's parent window, etc. Setting this flag blocks this propagation at this window, preventing events from being propagated further upwards.

option.name: wxWS_EX_TRANSIENT
option.help: Don't use this window as an implicit parent for the other windows: this must be used with transient windows as otherwise there is the risk of creating a dialog/frame with this window as a parent which would lead to a crash if the parent is destroyed before the child.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: This window should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: This window should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Attach a tooltip to the window.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Disable the window for user input. Note that when a parent window is disabled, all of its children are disabled as well and they are reenabled again when the parent is.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Shows or hides the window.

property.name: foreground_colour
property.help: Sets the foreground colour of the window.

property.name: background_colour
property.help: Sets the background colour of the window.

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for this window. This should not be used for a parent window if you don't want its font to be inherited by its children

property.name: context_help
property.help: Sets the help text to be used as context-sensitive help for this window.

property.name: derived_class
property.help: If you have derived a class from a wxWidget class and you want this component to use your derived class, then specify that class name here. You will need to add the header file for your class to the derived_header property.

property.name: derived_params
property.help: Specifies additional parameters to insert before the normal wxWidget class parameters.

property.name: derived_header
property.help: Specify the name of the header file that declares your derived class.

property.name: id
property.help: Specifies the window identifier. When generating Python code, a non wx.Widgets id will be global unless prefixed with self.

property.name: pos
property.help: Specifies the position to pass to the constructor for the window. A -1 indicates that the value should be calculated automatically.

property.name: size
property.help: Specifies the size to pass to the constructor for the window. A -1 indicates that the value should be calculated automatically. Automatic layout (such as calling SetSizerAndFit) may override these values.
